cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 315 miles E of Corpus Christi, Texas

motion.direction: N (nearly stationary, expected to turn WNW later today)

cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to drift west-northwest tonight, then northwest toward the central Texas coast, with inland progression toward east-central Texas by mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: mid-Texas coast near Matagorda Peninsula / Port O'Connor area

weather_observation.under_watch: Tropical Storm Watch; Storm Surge Watch
weather_observation.under_warning: None at the port (nearest Tropical Storm Warning begins at Port Aransas)
weather_observation.watch_coast: South of Port Aransas, TX to the Mouth of the Rio Grande (tropical storm); Baffin Bay, TX to Port Aransas, TX including Corpus Christi Bay (storm surge)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas, TX to Morgan City, LA (tropical storm warning – begins about 25 mi NE of the port)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Baffin Bay north-eastward to coastal Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (peak sustained 30–40 mph, gusts 45 mph) possible Monday afternoon through Tuesday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible in Corpus Christi and adjacent bays beginning late Sunday night and persisting into Tuesday
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast 3–7 inches with local totals near 10 inches; flash and urban flooding likely
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; minor river flooding possible
